:::: {.content-visible unless-format="revealjs"}
To link evidence logged by developers^[[{{< var validmind.developer >}}](/developer/validmind-library.qmd)] to your validation report:

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

1. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.^[[Working with the model inventory](/guide/model-inventory/working-with-model-inventory.qmd#search-filter-and-sort-models)]

1. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **{{< fa file >}} Documents** and select a Validation Report type file.^[[Working with model documents](/guide/templates/working-with-model-documents.qmd)]

   Expand any subsection of the validation report you would like to work with.

   For example, locate 2. Validation then select **2.1.1. Assumptions**.

1. In any section of the report where the button is available, click **{{< fa link >}} Link Developer Evidence**. 

   ![Validation report section 2.1.1. that shows a compliance assessment with the option to link to developer evidence](/guide/model-validation/link-developer-evidence.png){fig-alt="A screenshot of the validation report section 2.1.1. that shows a compliance assessment with the option to link to developer evidence" .screenshot}

1. On the **Link Developer Evidence to Validation Report** page that opens, select the evidence that is related to your assessment. 
   
   - Available evidence is associated with the relevant documentation section. 
   - If you are not sure if something is relevant, you can expand the section by clicking **{{< fa chevron-down >}}** for more details.

1. Click **Update Linked Evidence**.

   - Confirm that the newly linked-to evidence shown under Developer Evidence is accurate and is connected to the correct documentation section.
   - Evidence that needs your attention gets flagged with [{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Requires Attention]{.bubble .yellow-bg}. These sections get flagged automatically whenever a test result is above or below a certain threshold.

::::
